intro: Argostemma microcnide, commonly known as the small-leaf argostemma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, particularly found in countries like India and Thailand. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
